title: Interleaved Block-based Learned Image Compression with Feature Enhancement and Quantization Error Compensation
author: Shiqi Jiang (Shandong University), Hui Yuan (Shandong University), Shuai Li (Shandong University), Raouf Hamzaoui (De Montfort University), Xu Wang (Shenzhen University), Junyan Huo (Xidian University), ...
relevance_why: The proposed method emphasizes learning-based techniques and feature extraction processes that could potentially enhance audio processing tasks, especially in efficient data compression and representation.
background: Learned image compression focuses on optimizing the process of reducing image file sizes without significantly losing quality, using deep learning techniques to enhance encoding and decoding processes.
contribution: This paper introduces four modules: feature extraction, refinement, enhancement, and quantization error compensation to solve challenges in learned image compression, achieving improved rate-distortion performance.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing learned image compression methods rely on traditional deep learning structures that may not effectively exploit intra- and inter-image correlations.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances feature extraction through pixel shuffling and sub-image processing, allowing for better correlation exploitation and reduced redundancy.

key_innovation: The integration of pixel shuffling and sub-image partitioning in the feature extraction process stands out as a unique approach to improving compression efficiency.
real_world_impact: With its ability to outperform standard image compression methods, this technique holds promise for applications in effective image transmission, storage optimization, and applications related to multimedia content delivery.
limitations: The performance might vary with different images or patch sizes, as noted in the ablation study section of the paper.

new_terms.Learned Image Compression: **Learned Image Compression** refers to image compression techniques that leverage machine learning algorithms, predominantly deep learning, to optimize both the compression and decompression processes.
new_terms.Rate-Distortion Performance: **Rate-Distortion Performance** is a measure of the balance between the bitrate of the compressed image and the quality of the reconstructed image, where better models achieve lower bitrates without significant quality loss.
